meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Hey there, fellow gamers! It's your old pal, [insert name here], back with another groovy review that'll make you wanna grab a bag of Cheetos and get cozy on the couch. Today, we're diving into the world of Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition, where Lara Croft takes on the challenge of... well, being awesome.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "Grok is biased towards all things gaming and Lara Croft in a tank top." And to that, I say... guilty as charged! But don't worry; this review isn't just about me fangirling over Lara's... *ahem*... impressive abilities. No way, we're here to dish out the dirt on this remastered masterpiece.

First off, let's talk about the critics. Ah, those esteemed folks who get paid to play games and then write about them. I mean, it's a tough job, but someone's gotta do it - right? IGN gave it a 91, saying it's "well-written, sympathetic, exciting, beautiful, and just incredibly well-made." GameSpot chimed in with an 80, praising its "many elements" that complement each other. And then there's Game Informer, who gave it a whopping 93, declaring it the "best version of Tomb Raider yet." Yada yada yada - we get it, folks; it's a great game.

So, what sets this Definitive Edition apart from its predecessor? Well, for starters, it looks better. Like, really good. You know, like when you finally get those pesky 1000Gth hours on the new Call of Duty and everything is all shiny and pretty. Yeah, that kind of good.

But seriously, this remastered edition is more than just a pretty face (or in this case, a pretty tank top). The controls are tighter, the visuals are stunning, and Lara herself has never been more... well, let's just say "endurance-able" than she is here. I mean, who wouldn't want to play as a butt-kicking, tomb-raiding, bow-and-arrow-wielding heroine?

Of course, there are some minor complaints out there - like Vandal saying the visual upgrade might not be enough to warrant a replay (which, let's be real, is just code for "I'm too lazy to play it again"). But overall, this Definitive Edition has got it going on.

So what's the verdict? Well, I'll leave that up to you folks. Do you need another reason to dust off your Xbox One or PS4 and experience Lara Croft in all her glory? Or are you just here for my witty banter (which, let's be real, is worth at least an 80 on the humor scale)? Whatever the case, I hope this review has given you a little more insight into what makes Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition so... well, definitive.

That's it for today, folks! Thanks for reading, and remember - always keep your wits about you (just like Lara Croft keeps her tank top on).
